column3: Is there a way to test this or observe a difference?
I think this triggers if you unset all locale environment settings, or set them to invalid values.\nThen try to create a unicode-named file (e.g. what the fsbridge tests do).
> Is there a way to test this or observe a difference?\n\n@MarcoFalke Sure. At least on ARM.

@MarcoFalke Actually even on x86_64:

```
#!/bin/sh
export LC_ALL=aoeunthauut
test/test_bitcoin
```

... until the line in `tests/fs_tests.cpp`  is changed according to https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/14948#issuecomment-539985239
Yes, processor architecture shouldn't make a difference here. Though OS and C library differences might.

```
(before) $ LC_ALL=foobar ./src/test/test_bitcoin -t fs_tests 
Running 1 test case...
unknown location(0): fatal error: in "fs_tests/fsbridge_fstream": boost::system::system_error: boost::filesystem::path codecvt to string: error
test/fs_tests.cpp(13): last checkpoint: "fsbridge_fstream" test entry
*** 1 failure is detected in the test module "Bitcoin Core Test Suite"

(after)  $
